servinfo.title: DTC P0575: Cruise Control Input Circuit

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P0504: Brake Switch “A” / “B” Correlation:J24B and N32A Model .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: MAIN (ON/OFF) switch signal voltage remains at high level for specified time continuously

item.ptxt: Cruise control command switch (CANCEL switch, RES/ACC switch and/or SET/COAST switch) signal voltage remains at low level for specified time continuously
Cruise control switch and/or its circuit

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool to DLC.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC.
Start engine and warm up to normal operating temperature.
Drive vehicle at 40 km/h (25 mph) or higher for 3 min. or more.

attention3.ptxt: Before this troubleshooting, read and observe Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting:J24B or Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting:N32A

test1.ptxt: Check cruise control switch referring to Cruise Control Switch Inspection:J24B and N32A Model .

testgroup.title: Cruise control MAIN (ON/OFF) switch and command circuit check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection of cruise control switch circuit terminal to ECM connector.
If connections are OK, check the following for cruise MAIN (ON/OFF) switch and command circuit.

item.ptxt: Voltage of between “BLK/WHT” wire terminal of cruise control switch connector and vehicle body ground is 0 V with ignition switch tuned ON (power short check)
Resistance between “LT GRN” wire terminal and “BLK/YEL” wire terminal of cruise control switch connector are infinity (no continuity check)
Resistance between “LT GRN” wire terminal of cruise control switch connector and vehicle body ground is infinity (ground short check)

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
